      • getDbHandler

        public CachedDatabaseHandler getDbHandler()
                                   throws Nest.DatabaseHandlerNotInitialized
        Get the database handler for the selected connection. This function should only be called after the database handler has been initialized - which happens in the beginning of design-time metadata validation and process runtime.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        Nest.DatabaseHandlerNotInitialized

      • getProvider

        public DatabaseProvider getProvider()
                             throws Nest.DatabaseHandlerNotInitialized

        Throws:

      • getCurrentProvider

        public DatabaseProvider getCurrentProvider()
                                    throws com.rapidminer.parameter.UndefinedParameterError,
                                           ConnectionEntryNotFound
        Retrieves DatabaseProvider currently chosen by the nest's parameters. Do not use this during metadata validation and process execution - use getProvider() instead, for efficiency.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        com.rapidminer.parameter.UndefinedParameterError
        ConnectionEntryNotFound

      • checkInnerOperators

        protected java.util.List<com.rapidminer.operator.ports.quickfix.QuickFix> checkInnerOperators(Nest parent,
                                                                                              com.rapidminer.operator.Operator op,
                                                                                              boolean applyAutoFixes,
                                                                                              boolean throwOperatorError)
                                                                                       throws com.rapidminer.operator.UserError
        Check if all inner operators are InDatabase operators. InDatabase Nest is also illegal.
        Parameters:
        parent - Caller operator that collects the errors
        op - Operator to be examined
        applyAutoFixes - Apply the autofixes immediatly, or return them as a list.
        throwOperatorError - If set to true, the method will throw an error, instead of creating error messages/quick fixes.
        Returns:
        the list of autofixes, in case applyAutoFixes is false, empty list otherwise
        Throws:
        com.rapidminer.operator.UserError
